intro: Pedicularis myriophylla, commonly known as the flame violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from red to orange, often resembling those of the genus Rhododendron. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a notable species in botanical studies and horticulture.
